image.altText: Defence personnel treat injured koala.jpg

items.synopsis: Australia's war-fighting capability is being compromised by "near-persistent" demands to respond to domestic emergencies, according to findings from a parliamentary inquiry.

title.children: 'Forced to make impossible choices': Domestic demands hamper Defence's war-fighting powers

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair smiles at the camera in a hospital bed, holding up 4 fingers, to signify how many surgeries.

items.synopsis: An actor and comedian shares her experience on social media of feeling shamed in a pharmacy when trying to collect her prescribed pain medication.

title.children: Sydney comedian 'overwhelmed' by public response after sharing 'humiliating' experience buying drugs in pharmacy

image.altText: Marcia Langton at a press conference in Parliament House

items.synopsis: Bunburying is the art of concocting a noble-sounding alibi to provide cover for an undisclosed and less-noble objective. Why is this relevant today? Because senior First Nations academic Marcia Langton has been at the centre of a comprehensive Bunburying. Here's what transpired, writes Annabel Crabb.

title.children: There's a foul, rising tide of racism in the Voice debate ahead of the referendum

image.altText: A man wearing a suit jacket sits and speaks, gesturing with his hands, at a business summit

items.synopsis: Tim Gurner says he regrets comments he made at a media event, which were slammed by workers, unions and politicians.

title.children: Multimillionaire property developer admits comments about 'arrogant' workers were 'deeply insensitive'

image.altText: A glass office building with the purple NDIS sign out the front.

items.synopsis: The federal government is set to repeal the Disability Services Act and replace it with a new set of standards, which the Greens say is an opportunity to end the segregation of many disabled people from the rest of the community.

title.children: Changes to disability support outside NDIS with government to implement new set of standards

image.altText: Clownfish swimming near bleached coral off Lizard Island

items.synopsis: If Australia wants to keep the Great Barrier Reef — not just off the 'in danger' list, but also in existence — much more needs to be done, writes Michael Slezak.

title.children: The uncontroversial truth behind the Great Barrier Reef's 'good news'

image.altText: A woman hands a man a pamphlet.

items.synopsis: Western Sydney often makes or breaks federal governments at elections. Now, during the lead-up to the referendum, some communities are saying the Voice is not a priority for them, or that there’s not enough information.

title.children: Disengaged, unaware, undecided: The debate over the Voice in Western Sydney

image.altText: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price speaks at a podium at the National Press Club

items.synopsis: Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price tells the National Press Club the Voice to Parliament proposal is "flawed in its foundations".

title.children: 'I will not accept the lie': Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price rails against the Voice in Press Club address

image.altText: ​​​​​​​ Beachgoers lie on their towels on Tamarama beach during a hot spring day in Sydney, Australia, 2015

items.synopsis: Some parts of Australia could face temperatures up to 16 degrees Celsius above average as a prolonged, unseasonal spell of hot weather sets in over the next week.

title.children: South-east Australia set to bake as hot spring weather soars up to 16 degrees above average

image.altText: A man wears a mask while walking through Sydney's CBD

items.synopsis: Sydney's air quality on Thursday morning was the worst it has been since smoke from this week's hazard-reduction burns began blanketing the city.

title.children: Doctors report spike in respiratory issues as Sydney experiences 'very poor' air quality due to lingering smoke

image.altText: A forensics worker in a white suit at a crime scene at a house

items.synopsis: Police are still establishing whether two public-place shootings in Sydney in two days are linked.

title.children: Man gunned down in 'ambush-style attack' outside his Western Sydney home

image.altText: Sam and Liz holding baby Andy in front of a fire truck

items.synopsis: Liz and Sam Paul know how to stay calm in an emergency, which came in handy when baby Andy decided to arrive before they could make it to hospital.

title.children: Fries with that? Firefighters deliver their own baby in fast-food restaurant car park

image.altText: A young man in a suit looks down as he stands among a group of people outside a building

items.synopsis: A federal court judge finds the State of Victoria and the principal of Brighton Secondary College breached the Racial Discrimination Act after five students said they were subjected to anti-Semitic bullying.

title.children: Students subjected to anti-Semitic bullying, Nazi symbol graffiti win $435k payout in federal court ruling

image.altText: A group of women wearing yellow and green uniforms standing in a line jump in the air celebrating

items.synopsis: The Matildas' future FIFA Women's World Cup matches have been added to the anti-siphoning list, making it "more likely" Australians will be able to watch them play for free, the federal government says.

title.children: Government takes action to protect future Matildas matches from TV paywalls

image.altText: A fire burning up a hill with smoke billowing off it.

items.synopsis: The 2018 fire in southern NSW destroyed four homes and burned out of control for three months in a national park.

title.children: RFS made 'inexplicable' decision to leave fire that burned 20,000ha, inquiry hears

image.altText: Six members of the Nixon-McKellar family stand outside court.

items.synopsis: The mother of a young man who died after being arrested in Toowoomba says reading a statement "tailored" to the police service would have defeated its purpose.

title.children: 'No justice': Family refuses to read edited victim impact statement to death in custody inquest

image.altText: A gas production plant during sunset

items.synopsis: Woodside is temporarily blocked from moving ahead with part of the Scarborough gas project off Western Australia's northern coast.

title.children: Woodside temporarily blocked from carrying out seismic testing at major gas project off WA coast

image.altText: Mitt Romney and Donald Trump in the White House cabinet room looking serious

items.synopsis: From an election frontrunner to party outlier, Mr Romney's political legacy is one of highs and lows. Here's your rundown of the two-decade career of the Republican senator.

title.children: US senator Mitt Romney is retiring but his feud with Donald Trump will live on

image.altText: An aerial photo of a coastal historic city with many destroyed buildings and a wide divide in the middle cleared by a flood

items.synopsis: As the death toll is expected to rise in Libya's disastrous floods, Derna has been hit harder than any other city. Here's how crumbling infrastructure and a decade of political chaos left the region reeling.

title.children: As many as 20,000 may have died, so why has the destruction of Derna's dams caused so much chaos?

image.altText: A split image showing a whale swimming near the coast and a map detailing its migration overall.

items.synopsis: In a scientific first, researchers have tracked the lengthy journeys of a single southern right whale off Australia's southern cost.

title.children: Single Australian southern right whale’s 6,000km round-trip tracked for the first time

image.altText: An activist holds a banner reading 'Middle Arm Risks Health' and 'Our Children Need A Safe Climate'

items.synopsis: A United Nations expert warns three major NT oil and gas projects will "threaten to make Darwin and the region a climate change sacrifice zone".

title.children: UN expert warns NT Middle Arm project will raise risk of cancer, heart disease and asthma

image.altText: Carrara Stadium is lit up with blue lights for the opening ceremony.

items.synopsis: An interim report handed down by a Senate committee examining the Victorian government's decision to ditch plans to host the 2026 Commonwealth Games suggests prioritising finding another hosting option within Australia for that year.

title.children: Senator lashes premier for treating Victorians 'like a trash can' as Commonwealth Games report released

image.altText: Woman in street with red microphone talks to man with sunglasses.

items.synopsis: The man allegedly groped the Madrid reporter before interrupting her broadcast, leading politicians to condemn the "absolutely intolerable situation".

title.children: Spanish man arrested after 'machismo' grope of journalist live on air

image.altText: Albanese gestures to his colleagues while they all wear high vis vests and

items.synopsis: The $10 billion Housing Australia Future Fund has passed parliament, paving the way for new social and affordable homes to be built.

title.children: The government's $10bn housing bill has passed parliament, paving way for 30,000 new homes

image.altText: drone shot of a beach and buildings

items.synopsis: A planning law regarded as a key to fixing the housing crisis is creating an "impossible headache" for councils who say key staff are being tied up in court cases.

title.children: Costs mount as overwhelmed councils fail to meet 'damned near impossible' development deadlines

image.altText: Alan Beeby on a boat

items.synopsis: Son says the night Alan Beeby died plays "over and over" in his head as inquest into tragic cruise wraps up with deputy state coroner making early recommendations.

title.children: Alert boat owners, coroner says, as inquest into skipper's death draws to a close

image.altText: St Paul's School headmaster Dr Paul Browning

items.synopsis: Anglican Schools Commission chair Jeremy Greaves denied claims they fired Dr Browning over disagreements over how to compensate sex abuse survivors.

title.children: Anglican Church denies sacking principal over his plans to raise money for child sex abuse survivors

image.altText: a 10-year-old girl wearing earrings and makeup

items.synopsis: Three family members of a 10-year-old girl found dead at her home in England have been arrested more than a month after leaving the country for Pakistan.

title.children: Sara Sharif's father, stepmother, uncle arrested month after 10yo's body found

image.altText: A man poses with an Apple iPhone 12 in a mobile phone store in Nantes, France, September 13, 2023

items.synopsis: France's radiation watchdog claims tests on two iPhone 12s showed they breached European radiation exposure limits.

title.children: France has banned the sale of iPhone 12s over 'failed radiation tests'. What does this mean for Australians?

image.altText: A composite image of a fuel drum standing next to a crate.

items.synopsis: Drug trafficking is usually left to the streets of capital cities. But this consignment found its way to a small, idyllic rural Australian town.

title.children: $100 million meth tracked to tiny regional town after US Homeland Security alerts AFP

image.altText: A large pile of rubble, with mountains visible in the background.

items.synopsis: In the days since a deadly earthquake rippled through Morocco's High Atlas Mountain, devastating stories of loss have emerged. Seismic data and satellite imagery show the sheer scale of this destruction.

title.children: Deep in the Atlas Mountains, a monster was slowly growing. Moroccan villages on top had no chance
